results.title: Singlehanders
results.creator_credit: Shelagh Mackenzie, Kent Nason and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Alone on the open sea! Two Canadians, Bob Lush and Mike Birch, took cameras aboard their yachts during the 1980 Observer Singlehanded Transatlantic Race. The result is more than a record of this prestigious international sailing event. The sport of ocean racing becomes the starting point for an epic of challenge and determination.

results.title: Shakti - 'She is vital energy'
results.creator_credit: Monique Crouillere, Anne-Claire Poirier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Through a succession of mini-portraits, this documentary portrays a woman of rural India whose life, shaped by tradition and ritual, still follows a pre-determined course. Images of great visual beauty illustrate the various stages of her evolution, from childhood to old age. Her marriage to a young man of her parents’ choice is a turning point in her life. She must leave her family to become a member of her husband’s family. The woman of rural India moves through life with grace and dignity, regardless of the tasks she must perform. Voice and narration: Kelly Ricard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Monique Crouillere, Anne-Claire Poirier and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Petrochemicals
results.brief_description: This six part educational series deals with various aspects of the petrochemical industry and the part products play in everyday life. Parts of the program include: the building blocks, polymerisation reactions, polymers in use, solvents, detergents and industrial chemicals, agricultural chemicals, and chemistry in society.

results.title: Billal
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Australian Film Commission, ABC-TV (Australia) and AFFC
results.brief_description: Tom Zubrycki was intending to make a documentary film about unemployed youth in Sydney’s western suburbs when he came across the Etters, a Lebanese Muslim family who had migrated to Australia. What was initially meant to be a film exploring migration and class relationships in urban Australia became something else when the second son, Billal, was the victim of a racially motivated attack which left him brain damaged. As Zubrycki allows his camera to explore each individual family member’s response to the accident, the film becomes an exploration of grief and suffering, and a tribute to the young man’s attempt to adjust to his new situation. Billal and his family infuse their stories with humour and insight, and as the film explores Billal’s rehabilitation, it also becomes an absurd commentary on the under-resourced Australian public health system. “Billal” is then a documentary which is largely about family, and of how a family deals with the tragic consequences of violence. But it is also, of course, a documentary which with subtlety and piquancy, illuminates the destructive effects of racism.

results.title: Australian made
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, John McLean, Tom Hegarty Productions and Captured Live Productions
results.brief_description: Australian music came of age in the summer of 1987 when the cream of Oz rock swept the continent for the most ambitious series of open air concerts ever staged beneath the Southern Cross. Almost 140,000 fans in six cities were entertained with a diverse array of potent and imaginative rock - from understated avant-garde to tempestuous thunder from Down Under. The dynamic performances and behind-the-scenes activity of the tour has generated an exciting, fast paced and imaginative feature film. Includes performances by: INXS ; Jimmy Barnes ; The Triffids ; I’m Talking ; The Saints ; The Divinyls and The Models.

results.title: Steeltown
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Rex Tasker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Hamilton, the Pittsburgh or Birmingham of Canada. This is a rich and colorful subject that encourages imaginative treatment on the screen. The heart of the city is the immense complex of furnaces and rolling mills, but nearby are the lake, the mountain, and the rich fruit farms. How the work of the steel mills touches the city and its surroundings is shown in many views during both day and night.

results.title: The 80 goes to Sparta
results.creator_credit: Bill Davies and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The different faces of the Greek community in Montreal in 1969, with emphasis on cultural and economic problems encountered by new immigrants. The “80” refers to the bus to “80 Av. du Pare”. Music by The Greek Stars.

results.title: [Kids' fun: a compilation of cartoon adventures]
results.creator_credit: Castle Films, Animafilm Studio and Romania Film
results.brief_description: A collection of Romanian and classic American animation. First up are four fun-filled Romanian cartoons designed for young children (Music and sound affects, no spoken words). The characters Michaela, Benny and Tommy are seen here having fun with all of their animal friends. Following is a collection of classic American cartoons made between the 1930’s and 1950’s including the first Heckle and Jeckle cartoon.

results.title: A War story
results.creator_credit: Anne Wheeler and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How little a list of casualties tells the real story of war. Based on the diaries of Canadian doctor Ben Wheeler during his internment in a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp during World War II, this feature docudrama is not a “war story” in the conventional sense of strategy and battles, but rather a glowing account of the spirit and its will to survive physical and mental suffering. Newsreel footage of the fall of Singapore (where Major Wheeler was captured) has been interwoven with dramatic reconstructions of scenes inside the mining camp. An important aspect of this docudrama is that it is seen through the eyes of Ben Wheeler’s daughter as she interviews, in a very moving way, survivors of the camps. (Awards: Edmonton; New York; Ghent.) Cast: Doug Bagot, Rodrigue Deschenes, David Edney, W. Forrest MacDonald, Cecil Grinstead, Doug Kier, Patrick McGuigan, Allan Stebbings, Dean Stoker, Frank Turner, Gerry Whelpton, Tom Whitton.

results.title: The Ridge
results.creator_credit: Janet McLeod, Angela Borelli, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Victoria and Two-Up Films
results.brief_description: Outback New South Wales there’s a town where dreams can either be made or broken - a place that is harsh and dusty and sometimes unforgiving to those who dig its soil for the elusive gem that will hopefully one day make them rich. Lightning Ridge is one of Australia’s better-known opal fields, rich in history and highly regarded for its unique black opal. This documentary film follows the daily routine of some of those miners who have made the “Ridge” their home, and through their personal stories we learn just how dedicated and determined they can be in the belief that one day they will find the “big one”. Opal mining can be tedious, exciting or just plain hard work but at the Ridge, a town where men outnumber women by six to one, there is a shared camaraderie that unites the community, regardless of who you are or where you come from.
